ProfessionalSummary:
Over 15 years experience in large format and small format print media. Looking to continue my career in a
creative and challenging new design position. Well versed in Macintosh platform Adobe Creative Suite. Enjoy the
challenge of creating unique trade show graphics and collateral materials to help clients attract their target
market. See me for creative solutions to unique or everyday design challenges.

EducationDetails.Text: The Art Institute of Dallas -- Associates of Applied Arts 1999

ExperienceSummary.Description: ~~~~~~~~~~~   is experienced in the management of:  Sales; and Light Technical/Trades/Skilled Labor (Carpentry and Painting; Piping).    ~~~~~~~~~~~   has 20 years of work experience, with 2 years of management experience, including a mid-level position.
ExperienceSummary.ManagementStory:
Starting on 1/1/2004, the candidate held the following mid-level management position for 2 years:
	Title: GRAPHIC DESIGN COORDINATOR - 2ND CHAIR TRIAL SERVICES
ExperienceSummary.AttentionNeeded: ATTENTION: The candidate appears to have been in management in a past role (GRAPHIC DESIGN COORDINATOR - 2ND CHAIR TRIAL SERVICES), but was not in management in the most recent role as PREFLIGHT ARTIST for THE TRADE GROUP.

Positions.Description:
Creative design/quality check files throughout the entire large format print process from receipt of client art,
electronic proofs, pre-flight color samples and final printed graphics on a wide variety of materials

Specialty skills include: using spot colors to execute White/Matte/Glossy Inks onto PVC/Wood/Acrylic substrates for extra impact in conjunction with custom router shapes for both rigid and fabric materials.

Work closely with engineers to ensure custom booth graphics fit on the structure and client graphics are highly
visible once assembled. (i.e. doors/obstructions/finishes/materials)

Adept at developing creative design and preflight color adjustments using Adobe Creative Suite to exceed client
expectations.

Manage production schedule to achieve deadlines including calculating square-footage/time allowances for large and small projects. Routinely assist with preparation of many thousand square feet of graphics on very short
deadlines.

Work closely with sales reps and clients to achieve timely approvals and effective displays.

JobTitle.Raw: GRAPHIC DESIGN COORDINATOR - 2ND CHAIR TRIAL SERVICES
JobTitle.Normalized: GRAPHIC DESIGN COORDINATOR 2ND CHAIR TRIAL SERVICES

Positions.Description:
Designed large courtroom graphics & electronic presentations to enhance litigation team objectives.
Maintained corporate image through brochures, letterhead, business cards & box branding.
Worked directly with clients on creative development of litigation support graphics.

Designed large courtroom graphics & electronic presentations to enhance litigation team objectives.
Distributed and quality checked design projects
Performed inventory control of essential materials and supplies
Some supervisory duties including distributing workload among peers
Worked directly with clients on creative development of litigation support graphics and departmental requests

QualificationsSummary:
SKILLS
Teamwork. Time management. Communication. Problem solving. Self starter.

SOFTWARE
Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator. InDesign. PhotoShop. Acrobat. ESKO iCut Router Application. Navision
Project/Inventory Management Application. Microsoft Office Suite: PowerPoint. Excel. Word. Outlook.

PROFILE
Over 15 years experience in large format and small format print media. Looking to continue my career in a
creative and challenging new design position. Well versed in Macintosh platform Adobe Creative Suite. Enjoy the
challenge of creating unique trade show graphics and collateral materials to help clients attract their target
market. See me for creative solutions to unique or everyday design challenges.

EXPERIENCE
PREFLIGHT ARTIST - THE TRADE GROUP -- 2005 TO PRESENT
Creative design/quality check files throughout the entire large format print process from receipt of client art,
electronic proofs, pre-flight color samples and final printed graphics on a wide variety of materials

Specialty skills include: using spot colors to execute White/Matte/Glossy Inks onto PVC/Wood/Acrylic substrates
for extra impact in conjunction with custom router shapes for both rigid and fabric materials.

Work closely with engineers to ensure custom booth graphics fit on the structure and client graphics are highly
visible once assembled. (i.e. doors/obstructions/finishes/materials)

Adept at developing creative design and preflight color adjustments using Adobe Creative Suite to exceed client
expectations.

Manage production schedule to achieve deadlines including calculating square-footage/time allowances for large
and small projects. Routinely assist with preparation of many thousand square feet of graphics on very short
deadlines.

Work closely with sales reps and clients to achieve timely approvals and effective displays.

GRAPHIC DESIGN COORDINATOR - 2ND CHAIR TRIAL SERVICES -- 2004 TO 2005
Designed large courtroom graphics & electronic presentations to enhance litigation team objectives.
Maintained corporate image through brochures, letterhead, business cards & box branding.
Worked directly with clients on creative development of litigation support graphics.
COURTROOM SCIENCES, INC. -- 2001 - 2004
Designed large courtroom graphics & electronic presentations to enhance litigation team objectives.
Distributed and quality checked design projects
Performed inventory control of essential materials and supplies
Some supervisory duties including distributing workload among peers
Worked directly with clients on creative development of litigation support graphics and departmental requests

EDUCATION
The Art Institute of Dallas -- Associates of Applied Arts 1999

SKILLS
Teamwork. Time management. Communication. Problem solving. Self starter.

SOFTWARE
Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator. InDesign. PhotoShop. Acrobat. ESKO iCut Router Application. Navision
Project/Inventory Management Application. Microsoft Office Suite: PowerPoint. Excel. Word. Outlook.
